content.description: Thin and technical face climbing to an interesting crux with good exposure.

Climb the black slab left of Home Alone with well spaced bolts.  At the last bolt continue up the corner with small trad gear.

You can traverse left to Not Quite Stan with a long sling on the last bolt, or just TR the line off other anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts and small gear for corner

content.description: Fun climbing on scary rock.  Edge delicately up the slab.  The more bolts you clip, the safer you'll feel.  At the roof the climbing is great, the rock feels 'OK'.  Crank a few moves above the lip to the chains.
content.location: Located around the corner from Home Alone, past the good rock of Character Witness (11a) and Plea Bargain (10a).  Just behind these routes on the chossy slab to roof behind is Sexorcisto.

content.description: Climb right facing flakes and arete (crux) to hanging chockstone.  Stem from chockstone another bolt to anchors.
content.location: Right most route on Home Alone's second tier.

content.description: This crack system makes for a nice TR after climbing Home Invasion, which it shares anchors with.  It would require large gear to be lead.
content.location: The crack system on the left inside the Hidden Corridor

content.description: This bird poop covered ramp climbs the ramp deep in the chimney of the Hidden Corridor.
content.location: The oblivious ramp in the Hidden Corridor

content.description: Follow the line of bolts between Character Witness and Freaks and Phonies. User-friendly pockets ascend a gently overhanging wall. An excellent warm-up for the other climbs at Home Alone.
content.protection: 6 bolts. Lower from fixed wire-gates clipped into a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Plea Bargain is the third route left to right on the left wall of the U-shaped amphitheater.

content.description: Climb a bulge (crux) to a steep slab. The spicy runouts will keep you focused despite the modest grade.
content.location: Not Quite Stan ascends the wall immediately to the right of the crack at the start of Limestoned.

content.description: Climb past two bolts to the right of the big crack at the back of the right-facing corner. Step left across the crack to a ledge, clip the third bolt, and climb a flake on an unrelentingly vertical wall. Diagonal left to a good pocket, traverse back right, and do a burly pull-up from a sloping 1" wide edge to a good hold (crux). Continue up the face to a two shut, two bolt anchor. A "Wyoming .10d."
content.protection: 6 bolts. In late August 2006, only one of the anchor bolts was equipped with a quicklink. Lower from the two shuts or leave a biner/quicklink in the other bolt hanger.
content.location: Follow the Home Alone trail for 100', passing the cave, to the large right-facing corner.

content.description: Start near the obvious crack system and move onto the black face.  Angle right at the top to the shared anchor.
content.location: The left most face climb in the Hidden Corridor

content.description: A long, slabby, occasionally balancey jog up Ten Sleep history.  Climb past 10 bolts (crux around 4th or 5th bolt) to Fixe rap anchors.  Reportedly the first sport climb established in the entire canyon.
content.protection: 10 bolts.  A 60m rope is necessary to lower off this route.
content.location: The right side of the alcove that contains Limestoned.

content.description: Climb pockets up a black streak a few feet right of Plea Bargain. The crux is an awkward move past a flake below the Soup Sandwich belay ledge. (Caution: guano.)
content.protection: 7 bolts. Lower from two bolt hangers or diagonal up left to the Plea Bargain anchors.
content.location: Freaks and Phonies is the fourth route left to right in the U-shaped amphitheater.

content.description: Climb the bulging wall to a short layback on a small edge. Go left to a pocket, then back right to the right side of a flake (crux). Layback the flake into a shallow slot. Continue up the slot and a seam to a jug. The ring anchors are several moves higher.
content.protection: 6 bolts; 7 if you clip an anchor bolt on Character Witness and angle right for several 9 or 9+ moves to the Plea Bargain anchors. Lower from CW's rings or the fixed wire-gates on Plea Bargain.
content.location: Continue up the Home Alone trail past the cave and right-facing corner. Scramble up and over two boulders to a U-shaped amphitheater. From left to right, Character Witness is the second route on the left (north-facing) wall of the amphitheater. (The others are Always Keep it Loaded, .12a; Plea Bargain, .10a; Freaks and Phonies, .10b; and Soup Sandwich, 9.

climbs.name: Always Keep it Loaded
climbs.fa: Stan Price ( The God Father of Ten Sleep)

content.description:
This climb has some very fun and technical climbing. I remember using so weird foot-tec to keep me in the small holds at the crux. I also remember this route having some really cool pockets, like Freeform at Shelf or Drug Enemy at Sinks.

This alcove is a good hideout for when it is hotter than a pistol. When I was first here it was 110F at the post office in town.
content.location: This route is located in the alcove just beyond the first set of routes.

content.description:
The start of the route is unluckily covered in Bat Poo...

The individuals brave enough to ignore the poo, will be faced with juggy climbing up the slight overhang. Crux is at the top, and consists of a short powerful boulder problem right before the anchors.
content.location: Leftmost route in the first encountered Home Alone cave.

content.description: Start on fun jugs, which lead you to a large ledge.  From there, make a series of committing moves (with ledge-fall potential) to the next bolt.  The top section has some loose rock and a good bit of space.
content.location: This route is two bolt lines to the right of "Alone," and is the rightmost bolt line on the right side of the obvious cave.
